intro: Isonandra obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate isonandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are broadly ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and are borne in terminal inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
